title: THE TRACE
logline: A confused young woman drifts through a high school where periodic "pulses" knock student groups off-balance-until she finds the injured kids who finally see her, only to realize her help leaves a revealing stain that triggers an extraction and a real-world diagnosis.
theme: Some forces don't heal-they reveal what's been hiding.

lines.text: Leyla breaks the surface of a high school pool, gasps once, and blinks chlorine water away; lane ropes, tiled walls, and echoing acoustics make the space feel endless.
Nearby, synchronized swimmers move in perfect unison-smiles fixed, limbs precise-never acknowledging Leyla as she treads water alone at the edge of their formation.
From the top. Together.
lines.speaker: Coach

lines.text: A sudden pulse ripples through the pool area like a quiet quake; bodies wobble, a few heads dip under, then the swimmers snap back into synchronized alignment as if trained to recover instantly.
Above the pool on a catwalk, Tech 1 and Tech 2 in grey suits watch and write on clipboards without reacting; Leyla spots them for a beat, then loses them in the glare.
Recovery.
lines.speaker: Tech 1

lines.text: Baseline holds.
lines.speaker: Tech 2

lines.text: Leyla exits into the main hallway: lockers, trophy cases, club posters, fluorescent lights; students stream past in a steady current as a bell rings somewhere out of view.
Another pulse hits; a few students stumble into lockers and catch themselves, then keep walking as if nothing happened-movement resets, faces smooth out, the corridor resumes its flow.
Through open gym doors, cheerleaders hold a pyramid; the pulse arrives and barely shakes them-no fall, no panic, just a micro-adjustment and a wider smile.
Hold. Smile.
lines.speaker: Cheer Captain

lines.text: Leyla steps closer as if to speak, but the cheerleaders' eyes slide past her; she stops, then backs away, swallowed by the hallway stream again.
A ballet studio with a glass wall: inside, dancers rehearse quiet, controlled lines; Leyla approaches the glass and sees her own reflection layered over their disciplined movement.
Keep moving.
lines.speaker: Ballerina

lines.text: The pulse hits; ballet bodies wobble for a fraction, then return to perfect posture without help-self-contained recovery, no room for Leyla to matter.
On the far end of the hall, Tech 2 taps a note; Tech 1 watches Leyla drift away from the glass, tracking her path rather than the dancers.
No binding. Keep her moving.
lines.speaker: Tech 2

lines.text: Leyla reaches an older classroom: scuffed floor, taped marks, stacked chairs; inside, students with crutches, braces, and bandaged wrists practice a simple routine and then-unlike everyone else-look straight at her.
A pulse slams through the room; the Injury Club collapses messier than any group so far-crutches slip, knees buckle, bodies hit the floor hard.
Leyla grabs one falling student by the forearm and lifts; as she steadies them, a bright metallic tint smears across her palm and onto their skin like wet paint.
Don't-you marked me.
lines.speaker: Injury Kid

lines.text: Leyla tries to help another student up; the tint spreads across her fingers, leaving streaks on sleeves and wrists-more visible with every touch.
Stop touching us! Get it off!
lines.speaker: Injury Kid

lines.text: Panic flips to anger: students recoil, scrub at the stains, shove chairs aside; Leyla's hands hover, unsure, as if help itself has become the problem.
Outside the classroom window, Tech 1 flips a switch on a small control box; red emergency light floods the room, turning the metallic tint into a loud signal.
Flag. High signal.
lines.speaker: Tech 1

lines.text: Tech 1 and Tech 2 enter, take Leyla by both elbows, and pull her into the hallway; behind them, the Injury Club rages under red light, frantic to erase what's now visible.
We got what we needed.
lines.speaker: Tech 2

lines.text: Cut to a radiology room: a patient opens their eyes; the red urgency is gone, replaced by calm clinical routine.
The contrast highlighted a lesion. We found it early. Next step is treatment.
lines.speaker: Radiologist
